intro: Guettarda filipes, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its pendulous, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are elliptical in shape. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Guettarda filipes is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
